alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:33PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm producing torrential rainfall will impact portions of eastern Essex and northwestern Addison Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 832 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Weybridge, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Middlebury, Vergennes, Ferrisburg, Cornwall, Addison, Weybridge, Waltham, Ripton, Bristol, Monkton Ridge, Monkton, Monkton Boro, New Haven, Panton, Bridport, Ferrisburgh, Salisbury, Hancock, Lincoln, and East Middlebury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
